marketNews.title: US Core Inflation Below Expectations, Rate Cut Expectations Rise
marketNews.content:
The US Bureau of Labor Statistics on Wednesday (15 Jan) announced that core inflation in the United States eased year-over-year in December 2024 and came in below expectations, although headline inflation rose. Details:
- YoY inflation: 2.9% (consensus: 2.9%; Nov 2024: 2.7%)
- MoM inflation: 0.4% (consensus: 0.3%; Nov 2024: 0.3%)
- Core YoY inflation: 3.2% (consensus: 3.3%; Nov 2024: 3.3%)
- Core MoM inflation: 0.2% (consensus: 0.2%; Nov 2024: 0.3%)
The above development revives market hopes for more US rate cuts. Before the data release, the market was generally pessimistic with a higher-for-longer narrative, and the Fed was expected to cut rates by only 25 basis points this year. According to the CME FedWatch Tool on Thursday (16 Jan), the probability that the Fed will cut rates by more than 25 basis points in 2025 rose to 45%, up from 34.8% on 14 Jan 2025.
Following the inflation data, US equity markets closed higher on Wednesday (15 Jan): DJIA +1.6%, S&P 500 +1.8%, Nasdaq +2.4%. On the same day, the US Dollar Index (DXY) fell 0.16% to 109.1 and the 10-year US Treasury yield dropped 14 basis points to 4.653%.
In Indonesia, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed up 0.39% on Thursday (16 Jan), while the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield fell 9 basis points to 7.172% and the rupiah weakened 0.24% against the US dollar to 16,360.
Bank Indonesia’s Head of Monetary Management and Securities Asset Department, Edi Susianto, said the rupiah’s weakness remains under control. He noted the depreciation is short-term as the market digests Bank Indonesia’s decision to cut the BI Rate by 25 basis points to 5.75% on Wednesday (15 Jan).
Key Takeaway
Although the increased Fed rate-cut expectations are a positive signal for Indonesia, we assess the market will remain volatile until further clarity on the new US administration’s policy, which could affect rate direction. Donald Trump is scheduled to be inaugurated as US President on 20 Jan 2024 local time. The next Fed meeting is set for 28-29 Jan 2024 local time.
To cope with volatility from shifting rate narratives, investors can lock in short-term high-yield bonds with low volatility such as PBS003 (2-year maturity) offering a yield of 6.79% per annum.

tickerNews.title: BBNI Plans to Raise Dividend Payout Ratio to 55-60% for FY 2024
tickerNews.content: BBNI: Bank Negara Indonesia’s President Director, Royke Tumilaar, said on Wednesday (15 Jan) that the company is likely to raise its dividend payout ratio to a range of 55-60% for the 2024 fiscal year. In the previous year, BBNI distributed a dividend payout ratio of 50% of net profit for FY 2023. Royke stated that the increase will not affect BBNI because the company has strong capital.

tickerNews.title: BBTN to Receive Report on BTN Syariah Spin-off
tickerNews.content: BBTN: State-owned Enterprises Minister Erick Thohir said on Thursday (16 Jan) that he will receive a report from BTN President Director Nixon L. P. Napitupulu regarding the BTN Syariah spin-off this week. Previously, Nixon indicated in mid-December 2024 that the bank acquisition process would be completed in 1Q25, with the BTN Syariah spin-off expected to finish in mid-2025. BBTN mentioned in November 2024 that it is negotiating and drafting a conditional sale-and-purchase agreement to acquire a bank, without further details.

tickerNews.title: BREN Targets Additional 41 MW Geothermal Capacity in 2025
tickerNews.content: BREN: Barito Renewable Energy’s Director, Merly, said the company targets an additional geothermal power plant capacity of 41 MW in 2025, bringing the total operating geothermal power plant capacity (PLTP) to 907 MW. Previously, BREN announced in October 2024 that it would allocate USD 346 million over three years to add 104.6 MW capacity. Merly also noted that additional wind power capacity will start contributing to BREN’s revenue in 2026.

tickerNews.title: INKP Announces Change of Controlling Shareholder to Jackson Wijaya Limantara
tickerNews.content: INKP: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper and Tjiwi Kimia Paper Factory (TKIM) announced a change of the ultimate controlling shareholder from Oei Tjie Goan (Teguh Ganda Wijaya) to Jackson Wijaya Limantara, son of Teguh Ganda Wijaya. The change is intended as a leadership succession to ensure continuity of the company’s business.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Shares Bought by PT Arthakencana Rayatama (~3.6 Million Shares)
tickerNews.content: AKRA: PT Arthakencana Rayatama, the controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo, purchased approximately 3.6 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,189 rupiah per share between 10-13 Jan 2025. The total transaction value was about 4.3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Arthakencana Rayatama’s ownership in AKRA increased from 63.619% to 63.637%.

tickerNews.title: SUNI Wins Pertamina Hulu Sanga Sanga Casing Tender Worth ~130 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: SUNI: Sunindo Pratama announced that the company won a casing procurement tender from PT Pertamina Hulu Sanga Sanga with a bid value of approximately 130 billion rupiah. SUNI said the tender is expected to contribute to the company’s revenue and operating profit in 2025-2026.

tickerNews.title: TRIN Reports 2024 Marketing Sales of 1.89 Trillion Rupiah, Targets 1.8 Trillion in 2025
tickerNews.content: TRIN: Perintis Triniti Property’s President Director, Ishak Chandra, said the company recorded marketing sales of 1.89 trillion rupiah in 2024, an 81% year-over-year increase, surpassing the 2024 target of 1.5 trillion rupiah (126% of target). TRIN aims for marketing sales of 1.8 trillion rupiah in 2025, based on a more favorable property industry outlook.

tickerNews.title: CPRO Accelerates Repayment of Senior Facility Agreement Tranche B
tickerNews.content: CPRO: Central Proteina Prima announced that it has accelerated the repayment of the Senior Facility Agreement Tranche B in December 2024, thereby fully repaying the entire senior facility agreement. As of September 2024, CPRO had a Senior Facility Agreement Tranche B debt of USD 10.2 million.
